Name: Shabti of Petosiris
Description: This small funerary statuette was uncovered in one of the necropoleis of Abydos during the excavations of W. F. Petrie. It belongs to the "Prophet of Hathor" Petosiris, son of Djedher. The shabti, which bears a hieroglyphic version of Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead, is distinguished by a bichrome faience with a thick coat of glaze. The Brussels Museum also preserves four other shabtis of the same person (E.0485A-D).
